articles.headline: Ted Cruz’s Support Softens Among the Delegates He Courted
articles.snippet: The gravitational pull of Donald J. Trump’s recent primary landslides is drawing more Republicans toward him, threatening Mr. Cruz’s hopes of winning in a floor fight.
articles.abstract: The gravitational pull of Donald J. Trump’s recent primary landslides is drawing more Republicans toward him, threatening Mr. Cruz’s hopes of winning in a floor fight.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even as Donald J. Trump trounced him from New Hampshire to Florida to Arizona, Senator Ted Cruz could reassure himself with one crucial advantage: He was beating Mr. Trump in the obscure, internecine delegate fights that could end up deciding the Republican nomination for president.

articles.headline: Dilma Rousseff, Facing Impeachment in Brazil, Has Alienated Many Allies
articles.snippet: Many political analysts say the president’s slow-motion downfall is tied to an autocratic persona and a go-it-alone work style that has driven away scores of political allies.
articles.abstract: Many political analysts say the president’s slow-motion downfall is tied to an autocratic persona and a go-it-alone work style that has driven away scores of political allies.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRASÍLIA — They were idealists, united in the struggle against Brazil’s military dictators.

articles.headline: New York City Casts a Net to Catch the Next Big Start-Up
articles.snippet: A nonprofit, Tech:NYC, aims to make New York more appealing to start-ups, big tech companies and venture firms.
articles.abstract: A nonprofit, Tech:NYC, aims to make New York more appealing to start-ups, big tech companies and venture firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, New York — a city not accustomed to being second banana — has looked on as Silicon Valley has solidified its influence over the technology industry.

articles.headline: Halliburton and Baker Hughes Call Off $35 Billion Merger
articles.snippet: The news came after an excruciatingly long regulatory review process that culminated in a lawsuit by the Justice Department.
articles.abstract: The news came after an excruciatingly long regulatory review process that culminated in a lawsuit by the Justice Department.
articles.lead_paragraph: For a year and a half, Halliburton and Baker Hughes, two big oil field services companies, had been focused on their $35 billion merger. That distraction, even as commodity prices deteriorated and their peers cut costs to survive, is finally over.

articles.headline: For Women in Advertising, It’s Still a ‘Mad Men’ World
articles.snippet: Women now make up nearly half the advertising industry, yet it remains rife with sexist behavior, gender bias and pressure to be one of the guys.
articles.abstract: Women now make up nearly half the advertising industry, yet it remains rife with sexist behavior, gender bias and pressure to be one of the guys.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a so-called bathroom break girl at the advertising agency BBDO in 1985, Susan Credle took over for receptionists when they left their desks. When she learned how to type quickly and accurately, she was promoted to secretary. In the decades since, she has become one of the most accomplished women in the industry, holding top executive positions at some of the most esteemed creative agencies. She has been behind numerous memorable campaigns, including the humanlike M&M’s characters and Allstate’s Mayhem ads.

articles.headline: China Lending Inflates Real Estate, Stocks, Even Egg Futures
articles.snippet: Beijing’s infusions of cash to support its economy tend to lead to investment bubbles, often in unexpected places, as the commodities market shows.
articles.abstract: Beijing’s infusions of cash to support its economy tend to lead to investment bubbles, often in unexpected places, as the commodities market shows.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China is pouring hundreds of billions of dollars into its economy in a new effort to support growth. Some of it is going into roads and bridges and other big projects that will keep the economy humming.

articles.headline: Letting Stephen Colbert Be Stephen Colbert (Whoever That Is)
articles.snippet: CBS says it brought in a new executive producer for “The Late Show” so Mr. Colbert could focus on hosting. Now the network has to give him room to do what he does best.
articles.abstract: CBS says it brought in a new executive producer for “The Late Show” so Mr. Colbert could focus on hosting. Now the network has to give him room to do what he does best.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last Wednesday, the CBS chairman, Leslie Moonves, ducked into that night’s taping of Stephen Colbert’s “Late Show,” and then joined Mr. Colbert in his office above the Ed Sullivan Theater.

articles.headline: Stricter Rules for Voter IDs Reshape Races
articles.snippet: More than a dozen states will use the laws for the first time in a presidential election this fall, a step researchers say disproportionately affects minority voters.
articles.abstract: More than a dozen states will use the laws for the first time in a presidential election this fall, a step researchers say disproportionately affects minority voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO — In a state where everything is big, the 23rd Congressional District that hugs the border with Mexico is a monster: eight and a half hours by car across a stretch of land bigger than any state east of the Mississippi. In 2014, Representative Pete Gallego logged more than 70,000 miles there in his white Chevy Tahoe, campaigning for re-election to the House — and lost by a bare 2,422 votes.
articles.byline: By Michael Wines and Manny Fernandez

articles.headline: He’s Bitcoin’s Creator, He Says, but Skeptics Pounce on His Claim
articles.snippet: Craig Steven Wright of Australia presented digital evidence linking him to Satoshi Nakamoto, the pseudonym of the currency’s creator; not everyone was convinced.
articles.abstract: Craig Steven Wright of Australia presented digital evidence linking him to Satoshi Nakamoto, the pseudonym of the currency’s creator; not everyone was convinced.
articles.lead_paragraph: An Australian entrepreneur claimed on Monday to be the creator of the online currency Bitcoin. Within hours, the skepticism started.
articles.byline: By Paul Mozur and Nathaniel Popper

articles.headline: Catching a Flight? Budget Hours, Not Minutes, for Security
articles.snippet: Fewer T.S.A. screeners, tighter budgets, new checkpoint procedures and growing numbers of passengers have led to epic security lines, and there’s no end in sight.
articles.abstract: Fewer T.S.A. screeners, tighter budgets, new checkpoint procedures and growing numbers of passengers have led to epic security lines, and there’s no end in sight.
articles.lead_paragraph: Security lines at airports are getting longer — much longer — and wait times could reach epidemic levels when air travel peaks this summer, according to airlines, airports and federal officials.

articles.headline: Experts Warn of Backlash in Donald Trump’s China Trade Policies
articles.snippet: They say that his proposals are more likely to deepen the United States’ economic pains, particularly if China or other targeted nations retaliate.
articles.abstract: They say that his proposals are more likely to deepen the United States’ economic pains, particularly if China or other targeted nations retaliate.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the campaign trail, Donald J. Trump has promised to do quite a few things that are beyond the powers of an American president, like billing Mexico for a border wall. But when it comes to foreign trade, his powers as president would come closer to his expansive ambitions.
